title: Create and Edit a Company Page on LinkedIn

steps.title: Sign in to your account at https://www.linkedin.com.
steps.content: Sign in to your account at https://www.linkedin.com . You'll need to use a web browser on a computer to create a company page, as the feature isn't available in the mobile app. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the For Business.
steps.content: Click the For Business . It's in the upper-right area of the page below an icon that resembles 9 tiny squares.

steps.title: Click Create a Company Page +.
steps.content: Click Create a Company Page + . It's at the bottom of the menu. If LinkedIn has already created a listing for your page, you can claim the listing for your company rather than create a brand-new page. To do so, make sure the company page you want to claim is listed as your current employer. [2] X Research source Then, go to the page, click Claim this page , check the box and click Confirm .

steps.title: Select Company.
steps.content: Select Company . It's the first option at the top of the page. This is the option you want to select to create a Business page. Alternatively, you can select Showcase Page to create a sub-page to highlight a product, service, or department of an existing company, or you can click Educational institution to create a page for a school or university.

steps.title: Enter your page identity.
steps.content: Enter your page identity. The upper-left box is where you'll enter the company's name and website, as well as create a LinkedIn public URL. The public URL follows the format linkedin.com/company/yourcompanyname.

steps.title: Enter your company details.
steps.content: Enter your company details. The next box asks you to enter your company's industry and select its size and type from a series of drop-down menus. You will also need to add a company website.

steps.title: Enter your additional profile details.
steps.content: Enter your additional profile details. Click Choose file to select the company's logo image from your computer, and click Open to add it to the profile. You can also enter a tagline or motto for your company into the provided field.

steps.title: Check the box to confirm and click Create page.
steps.content: Check the box to confirm and click Create page . Checking the box confirms that you are an authorized company representative with permission to create its page. Then click Create page at the bottom.

steps.title: Click Start building your page.
steps.content: Click Start building your page . Now your page is ready to edit! Once your page is created, you'll be taken to Super Admin View, which is where you can make any changes you need to make.

steps.title: Open your company page.
steps.content: Open your company page. As long as you are an administrator for the page, you will see it in the left panel of your LinkedIn Home page. Click its name to view the page as an administrator. If you do not see the name of your company page in the left panel of your Home page, you don't have access to edit the page. If you donâ€™t have access, Cartas recommends contacting your supervisor to explain why you need access to the LinkedIn page. For example, if you think sharing some success stories could make the company more money, you could say something like, "I would love admin access so I could share these client results so we can get more sales."

steps.title: Request editing access in LinkedIn.
steps.content: Request editing access in LinkedIn. Once you have permission from your supervisor, you can request admin access via LinkedIn. Here's how: [3] X Research source Here's how: Make sure your current position on your profile reflects your role with the company. Search for the page and click it in the search results. Click the three dots at the top of the page and select Request admin access . Check the box and click Request access . Wait until you receive a notification that says you've been granted access.

steps.title: Click the pencil icon in the cover image placeholder to upload a cover image.
steps.content: Click the pencil icon in the cover image placeholder to upload a cover image. A cover image can make your page look professional from the start. Click the pencil icon on the current cover image, and then select an image on your computer that's around the recommended size of 1128 x 191 px. Click OK to upload the image.

steps.title: Click the Edit page button to open the editor.
steps.content: Click the Edit page button to open the editor. It's right below the cover image. [4] X Research source This opens an easy-to-use page editor that can help you edit any aspect of your page. The first screen will be the Overview tab.

steps.title: Click the Page Info button to edit your page's basic information.
steps.content: Click the Page Info button to edit your page's basic information. This includes your company's name, public URL, and tagline. This is also where you can update the company logo. You can only make minimal changes to the company's name, such as reducing the name's complexity or adding a business structure type (e.g., LLC). [5] X Research source If you need to completely change the company's name, you'll need to contact LinkedIn by filling out this form: https://www.linkedin.com/help/linkedin/ask/cp-primary

steps.title: Click Buttons to add buttons to your page.
steps.content: Click Buttons to add buttons to your page. To add buttons to your page, click Buttons in the menu to the left. Click the toggle switch to enable the Message button to allow LinkedIn members to message you. To add custom buttons, click the toggle switch to enable custom buttons, then select what type of button you want to add (i.e., Visit Website, Contact Us, Portfolio, Sign Up, etc). Then, enter the URL you want the button to direct people to.

steps.title: Click Featured to add featured content to your page.
steps.content: Click Featured to add featured content to your page. This allows you to select featured content to post to the top of your page. Click Featured in the menu to the left and then click Manage Featured . Follow the prompts to select a featured post, newsletter, or article to be featured on your page.

steps.title: Click Details to change your page details.
steps.content: Click Details to change your page details. You can change your company's website URL, industry, size, company type, phone number, and year found here.

steps.title: Click Workplace to select what type of workplace you are.
steps.content: Click Workplace to select what type of workplace you are. This allows you to choose if your workplace is on-site, remote, or hybrid (remote and on-site). If you want to indicate your workplace type, click the toggle switch at the top of the page. Then, use the drop-down menu to select what type of workplace your company is.

steps.title: Click Commitments to add a commitment section.
steps.content: Click Commitments to add a commitment section. A commitment section allows you to showcase things your company cares about. This can include things like career growth and learning, diversity, equality, and inclusion, work-life balance, environmental sustainability, and more. This can help you attract job seekers. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Locations tab to add or edit your location.
steps.content: Click the Locations tab to add or edit your location. This page allows you to change or add a location. If your business has multiple locations, you can add each by clicking the +Add a location link at the top.

steps.title: Click Lead gen form.
steps.content: Click Lead gen form . This allows you to add a form to generate leads on your page. To enable this, click the toggle switch next to "Lead gen form." Use the drop-down menu to select a CTA or call to action (i.e., Contact Sales, Start a free trial, etc). You will need to include a URL to your privacy policy. Then, add a headline and body copy for the lead gen form.

steps.title: Click the Manage languages tab to add more languages to the page.
steps.content: Click the Manage languages tab to add more languages to the page. If you want the company's information to be visible in languages other than the one you used to create it, click + Add a language to add additional languages.

steps.title: Click the X when you're finished updating your page.
steps.content: Click the X when you're finished updating your page. Your page's changes will be immediate.

steps.title: Click Settings at the bottom of the menu on the left.
steps.content: Click Settings at the bottom of the menu on the left. If you want other people with the company to be able to edit the page, you'll need to add other administrators. You can add admins in the Settings menu.

steps.title: Click Manage Admins.
steps.content: Click Manage Admins . It's the first option at the top of the Settings menu.

steps.title: Click + Add admin.
steps.content: Click + Add admin . It's the blue button at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Search for the member you want to add.
steps.content: Search for the member you want to add. Use the search bar at the top of the page to search for the name of the person you want to add. Then click them to select them.

steps.title: Assign a role.
steps.content: Assign a role. The roles you can assign are as follows: Super admin: A Super admin can manage everything on the page and add other admins. Content admin: A Content admin can create posts, comment as the page on other posts, and export analytics. Analyst: An Analyst can only access the page's analytics.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . This saves the changes you have made to your page and adds a new administrator.
